result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry R. Williams II

defendant.name: Williams, Jerry R., II

records.addlTxt:
3:02PM (64-06) Defendant Jerry R. Williams II in court.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw in court for Jerry R. Williams II.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin DA Wiedenfeld in court. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
State is requesting an Arraignment date.

Adj. 3:05PM
Arraignment scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jerry R. Williams II in court.  Attorney Kirk Emick in court on behalf of Attorney Morgan Risseeuw for Jerry R. Williams II.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing information and rights given, hearing requested. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 328732,
Payable Number: 269036,
Receipt Number: 22R 018922,
Amount: $20.00
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22CF523 & 22GF896

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 
22-4520, 22-3963

Defendant Jerry R. Williams II in court, in custody, by video.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared for bond purposes only. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Complaint read by court. Possible felony bail jumping charge coming. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
